forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind 13 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 68 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco tonight, the atmosphere hangs thick with clouds, casting a muted glow over the city as the temperature dips to a mild 57 degrees. A crisp west-southwest wind sculpts the air, teasing the slight chill that lingers after sunset. As the evening deepens, the vibrant heartbeat of the city flickers to life, with the soft murmur of distant laughter and chatter rising from the sidewalk cafés. The marine layer may be creeping in from the bay, veiling the Golden Gate Bridge in a ghostly embrace, hinting at a typical San Francisco evening.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, a promise of sunshine dances on the horizon. By daybreak, the clouds will part to reveal a generous spread of blue, with a high near 70 calling out for activities in the fresh daylight. The winds will stretch themselves, blowing breezy and invigorating at 10 to 21 mph, making it the perfect time for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or a visit to one of the many parks. A light jacket or a cozy sweater may be your best companions as the temperature cools throughout the afternoon. Embrace the simple joys of the day—perhaps a visit to the Ferry Building to savor artisanal treats or a meander through Chinatown, savoring the rich history and vibrant colors around you. This is a day best spent outdoors, where the gentle warmth of summer lingers just a breath away.
